Migration: France agrees to return deal with UK
description: Paris has agreed to take back individuals who managed to cross the Channel but are not eligible for asylum in the UK. In exchange, London will accept those who qualify for asylum through a legal process. Approximately 21,000 people have reached England in small boats since the beginning of the year.

Trump threatens 35% tariff on Canadian exports
description: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday, July 10, that Canada will face a 35% tariff on exports to the United States starting August 1, escalating tensions in ongoing trade negotiations as both countries aim to finalize a deal by July 21.

headline: US warns ICC member states to drop proceedings against Israel
description: Washington has threatened the International Criminal Court with further reprisals if it maintains arrest warrants against Benjamin Netanyahu and former Israeli defense minister Yoav Gallant. The US has already imposed sanctions on five judges and prosecutors.

headline: Is it ever a good idea to... wear a speedo on the beach?
description: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

headline: In Srebrenica, 30 years after the genocide, the 'vicious circle' of denial continues
description: On July 11, Bosnia and Herzegovina commemorates the massacre of 8,000 Bosniaks by the forces of Serb General Ratko Mladic. Yet in a country still divided between Muslim Bosniaks, Catholic Croats and Orthodox Serbs, the work of remembrance remains far from unanimous.

Nan Goldin confronts Arles photo festival audience about Gaza war: '75,000 Palestinians have been killed'
description: The American photographer and winner of the Women in Motion award took advantage of Tuesday's opening night, alongside writer Edouard Louis, to project images of the Palestinian territory ravaged by the Israeli conflict and call for action.

headline: In Tunisia, migrants are driven out and their defenders prosecuted
description: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (5/5). For the past two years, the administration of Tunisian President Kais Saied, funded by the European Union, has been pushing sub-Saharan Africans far from cities, sometimes violently, and cracking down on any person or non-profit organization that supports them.

headline: 'Faced with Trump and an out-of-touch Democratic leadership, a left-wing surge is taking hold in the US'
description: On June 24, Zohran Mamdani, a member of the Democratic Party's left wing, won the party's nomination for mayor of New York City. While his path to victory will likely be difficult, academic Mathieu Bonzom argues that the rise of the American left is becoming increasingly credible.
